Class Sudoku

  • public class Sudoku
extends LatinSquare

    • Field Detail

      • iSize

        private int iSize
        iSize - the length of the width/height of the Sudoku puzzle.
        Since:
        Lab #2

      • iSqrtSize

        private int iSqrtSize
        iSqrtSize - SquareRoot of the iSize. If the iSize is 9, iSqrtSize will be calculated as 3
        Since:
        Lab #2

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sudoku

        public Sudoku(int iSize)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Sudoku - for Lab #2... do the following: set iSize If SquareRoot(iSize) is an integer, set iSqrtSize, otherwise throw exception
        Parameters:
        iSize- - length of the width/height of the puzzle
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the iSize given doesn't have a whole number square root
        Since:
        Lab #2

      • Sudoku

        public Sudoku(int[][] puzzle)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Sudoku - pass in a given two-dimensional array puzzle, create an instance. Set iSize and iSqrtSize
        Parameters:
        puzzle - - given (working) Sudoku puzzle. Use for testing
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - will be thrown if the length of the puzzle do not have a whole number square root
        Since:
        Lab #2

      • getRegion

        public int[] getRegion(int iCol,
                       int iRow)
        getRegion - figure out what region you're in based on iCol and iRow and call getRegion(int)
        Parameters:
        iCol - given column
        iRow - given row
        Returns:
        - returns a one-dimensional array from a given region of the puzzle
        Since:
        Lab #2

      • getRegion

        public int[] getRegion(int r)
        getRegion - pass in a given region, get back a one-dimensional array of the region's content Example... a 4x4 puzzle has four regions... region 0, 1, 2, 3. Region 0 is top left, region 3 is bottom right.
        Parameters:
        r - given region
        Returns:
        - returns a one-dimensional array from a given region of the puzzle
        Since:
        Lab #2

      • isPartialSudoku

        public boolean isPartialSudoku()
        isPartialSudoku - return 'true' if... It's a LatinSquare If each region doesn't have duplicates If each element in the first row of the puzzle is in each region of the puzzle At least one of the elemnts is a zero
        Returns:
        true if the given puzzle is a partial sudoku
        Since:
        Lab #2

      • isSudoku

        public boolean isSudoku()
        isSudoku - return 'true' if... Is a partialSudoku Each element doesn't a zero
        Returns:
        - returns 'true' if it's a partialSudoku, element match (row versus column) and no zeros
        Since:
        Lab #2

      • isValidValue

        public boolean isValidValue(int iCol,
                            int iRow,
                            int iValue)
        isValidValue - test to see if a given value would 'work' for a given column / row
        Parameters:
        iCol - puzzle column
        iRow - puzzle row
        iValue - given value
        Returns:
        - returns 'true' if the proposed value is valid for the row and column
        Since:
        Lab #2
